questions.question: Why do some formats have writer feature types without a Geometry parameter?
options: These formats automatically set geometry to match the geometry of the first feature they receive.
These formats require the user to set geometry using a GeometryCoercer.
These formats set geometry type based on a propriety dynamic definition algorithm.
These formats support multiple geometry types in a single writer feature type, or they do not support any kind of geometry (i.e., non-spatial formats)

questions.question: What happens when a writer feature type receives data with geometry that is different from the schema, and the destination format does not support multiple geometry types?
options: The writer writes the features with different geometry types
The writer sets the geometry type back to a fixed value
The writer drops the features instead of writing them
FME automatically changes the schema source to point to another dataset

questions.question: What is the First Feature Defines Geometry Type option used for?
options: To set the geometry type manually
To define the geometry from a schema definition
To define the geometry type based on the first feature the writer receives
To override the geometry defined by the chosen schema source
